bibl.title: Yaichiro Goto v. Henry M. White. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
In the Matter of the Application of YAICHIRO GOTO, otherwise known as YAICHIRO MATSUO, For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Judges of the above entitled court:
The petition of Yaichiro Goto, otherwise known as Yaichiro Matsuo respectfully shows to this court:

That the petitioner is a subject of the Empite of Japan and that he is now imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or by a person, or persons acting by, through, or under him, at the detention house at the Immigration Station in the City of Seattle.

That petitioner is being on charge that he was convicted of a crime involving moral terpitude within two years after his entry into the United States, and that he entered the United States without inspection. That, though no fair hearing was accorded said petitioner, the Secretary of Labor at Washington, D. C., or someone in his behalf have wired telegraphic orders to the Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, at Seattle, ordering petitioner to be deported to the Empire of Japan, and this petitioner respectfully informs the court that said imprisonment, confinement and restraint, and the order of deportation is illegal, and not according to law: WHEREFORE:

This petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus to be directed to the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington may issue in his behalf so that this petitioner may be forthwith brought before this honorable court to submit to, and receive what the law may direct, and your petitioner will ever pray.

Yaichiro Goto, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says: That he is the petitioner herein; that he has read to foregoing petition, knows the contents thereof, and that the same are true; and that he believes said facts to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 30th day of March, 1921.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle in said state.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Yaichiro Goto, otherwise known as Yaichiro Matsuo.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
Service of papers in this case may be made upon Attorney for at No. Street Room Block
